setmeup 0.0.0.9001

Assign ID values to distinct dataframe rows

assign_id.Rd

Assign sequential ID values to distinct dataframe rows based on the variables specified in vars.

Usage

assign_id(
  df,
  vars,
  id_name,
  prefix = NULL,
  seq_start = 1,
  digits = NULL,
  promote = TRUE
)

Arguments

df

A dataframe.

vars

Variables for determining row uniqueness.

id_name

The name for the ID variable.

prefix

An optional prefix added to all ID values.

seq_start

The start number of the ID sequence.

digits

The number of digits in the ID, including leading zeros. This is used when larger than the minimum required.

promote

Logical. If TRUE, the ID variable is the first column in the output.

Value

A dataframe.

Details

Row names are not preserved.

Examples

df <- data.frame(
  var1 = rep(LETTERS[1:3], 4),
  var2 = 1:2
)

assign_id(
  df,
  id_name = "id",
  prefix = "id",
  vars = colnames(df)
)
#>     id var1 var2
#> 1  id1    A    1
#> 2  id2    B    2
#> 3  id3    C    1
#> 4  id4    A    2
#> 5  id5    B    1
#> 6  id6    C    2
#> 7  id1    A    1
#> 8  id2    B    2
#> 9  id3    C    1
#> 10 id4    A    2
#> 11 id5    B    1
#> 12 id6    C    2
